title: Ngā Ingoa o Aotearoa
subtitle: He papakupu kōrero o ngā ingoa wāhi
intro: The pages of this website are not the dictionary. The audio recordings are the dictionary. The pages are just a guide to the recorded words. They are a dictionary of the pronunciations of placenames only, not their meanings. The places are sorted into "Zones", and each Zone is about the size of a county. They are divided by tribe and also along lines of convenience. To distinguish the Zones from the places, the Zones have English names, "where such have been bestowed."
disclaimer: Just because a name has been put in a particular Zone, or is spoken by a particular person, that does not mean I claim that the place belongs to any particular people. That is not what this dictionary is for, but every name had to be assigned to somebody.
instructions: Please choose an island to find the place name you are looking for, or use the search box at the top of this page.

about: Ngā Ingoa o Aotearoa (The Names of New Zealand) is probably the first "pronouncing dictionary" that is literally "pronouncing". The 10,200 names are spoken by 139 native speakers of Māori, chosen by each other as the best speakers for their areas.
imagemap: Click on a zone on the map below to be taken to the placenames for that zone (hover over the map to see the names of the zones).
name: ingoa
speaker: kaikōrero
